lesson_html:
• Hello! - A common way to greet someone.
  • How are you? - A friendly question to ask about someone's well-being.
  • Good morning/afternoon/evening! - Time-specific greetings to show politeness.
  • Nice to meet you! - Used when you meet someone for the first time.
  • Goodbye! - A way to say farewell when parting ways.

items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's recent state.
This is a common question to inquire about the current time.

items.en: Do you have any plans for today?
items.explanation_en: This question asks if someone has activities scheduled for the day.

items.en: I hope you are doing well.
items.explanation_en: This expresses a wish for someone's good state.

items.en: What did you do last weekend?
items.target: ¿Qué hiciste el fin de semana pasado?
items.explanation_en: This question inquires about activities from the previous weekend.
This asks if someone is having a good time during their holiday.

items.en: I look forward to seeing you again.
items.explanation_en: This expresses anticipation for a future meeting.

items.en: What are you up to these days?
items.explanation_en: This question asks about someone's current activities.

items.en: Have you been to any good restaurants lately?
items.explanation_en: This inquires about recent dining experiences.

items.en: Are you ready for the weekend?
items.target: ¿Estás listo para el fin de semana?
items.explanation_en: This asks if someone is prepared for the upcoming weekend.
